# prepareForReuse()

**Instance Method**

Restores the view to an initial state so that it can be reused.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func prepareForReuse()
```

## Discussion

The default implementation of this method sets the view’s alpha to `1.0` and its hidden state to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. Subclasses can override this method and use it to return the view to its initial state. Subclasses should call `super` at some point in their implementation.

This method offers a way to reset a view to some initial state so that it can be reused. For example, the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView] class uses it to prepare views for reuse and thereby avoid the expense of creating new views as they scroll into view. If you implement a view-reuse system in your own code, you can call this method from your own code prior to reusing them.
